newsitem.title: MEXICO: TMM says railway financing not yet ready.
newsitem.headline: TMM says railway financing not yet ready.

text.p: Mexico's Transportacion Maritima Mexicana (TMM) has not yet completed financing plans for its half of the $1.4 billion Northeast Railway concession, company spokesman Pedro Mejorado told Reuters Friday.
"The truth is we still don't have a definite date to close the financing," he said.
Earlier this week another company official said it planned to have financing details ready by the week's end.
TMM, with railroad partner Kansas City Southern Industries Inc., will owe the government $560 million of the railway concession on Jan. 31. The remaining payment is due June 5.

Company officials have not provided any details of financing plans but have suggested the payment could include a combination of bond and stock offers. On Dec. 19 TMM placed $200 million in Yankee Bonds through the New York Stock Exchange.
